reviews.review_msg: I actually thought this was a pretty good course.  At first, it looked very intimidating and overwhelming, especially for someone with little background in kinesiology.  However, with a bit of effort, it didn?t turn out to be so bad after all. It was actually a very interesting course and the prof is very helpful if you just ask!

Very little teaching going on - need to memorize and regurgitate countless studies and textbook readings. Textbook is nigh incomprehensible. Assignments unreasonably long, expectations extremely unclear.
Absolutely obsessed with theories of aging - wants them to be applied to everything without any evidence whatsoever - very unscientific.  Material is becoming dated.
Memorization and regurgitation of text counts for everything; integration asked for but not valued. Too many assignments with deadlines before the material is covered.
very picky about details...write out EVERYTHING mentioned in the text for assignment questions
